body_html:
This is my system info:

  • OS: 4.14.34-1-MANJARO
  • Python version: 3.6.4
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.1.85.2 / 7.1.2
  • GPU models and configuration: GeForce 920MX , NVIDIA-SMI 390.48 , Driver Version: 390.48
  • GCC version: 6.4.1 20171003 (in /opt/cuda/bin/gcc)
  • CMake version: 3.10.3

I also have gcc-5 and gcc 7 installed in /usr/bin/gcc* .

Since i've already cloned git repo, i just pulled new changes and started compiling:

git checkout master
git pull
git submodule update --init
git checkout v0.4.0
export CC=gcc-6
export CXX=g++-6
python setup.py clean
python setup.py install

Unfortunately i've lost my log but the error was started with like .../include/c++/tuple:483:67: error: mismatched argument pack lengths while expanding (4, should be 2). I've found these related issues:
#1898 and #3963.
So i've decided to go with gcc-5 which doesn't support -fno-plt flag but anyway i've managed to finish building process after about 2 hours! while i could compile pytorch v0.3.1 in about 40 minutes.

body:
This is my system info:
- OS: 4.14.34-1-MANJARO
- Python version: 3.6.4
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.1.85.2 / 7.1.2
- GPU models and configuration: GeForce 920MX , NVIDIA-SMI 390.48 , Driver Version: 390.48
- GCC version: 6.4.1 20171003 (in /opt/cuda/bin/gcc)
- CMake version: 3.10.3

I also have gcc-5 and gcc 7 installed in /usr/bin/gcc* .

Since i've already cloned git repo, i just pulled new changes and started compiling:
```
git checkout master
git pull
git submodule update --init
git checkout v0.4.0
export CC=gcc-6
export CXX=g++-6
python setup.py clean
python setup.py install
```
Unfortunately i've lost my log but the error was started with like `.../include/c++/tuple:483:67: error: mismatched argument pack lengths while expanding (4, should be 2)`. I've found these related issues: 
[#1898](https://github.com/caffe2/caffe2/issues/1898) and [#3963](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/3963).
So i've decided to go with `gcc-5` which doesn't support `-fno-plt` flag but anyway i've managed to finish building process after about 2 hours! while i could compile pytorch v0.3.1 in about 40 minutes.
